info.name: Fulqrom Hub API
info.description:
Fulqrom Hub REST API - Australian commercial real estate and HVAC&R building management platform

## Authentication
This collection uses Auth0 for authentication. Use the "Auth0 Login" request to get your access token, which will be automatically saved to the collection variable `access_token`.

## Setup
1. Import this collection into Postman
2. Set up environment variables (or use collection variables)
3. Run "Auth0 Login" to get your token
4. All other requests will use the token automatically

## Variables
- `AUTH0_DOMAIN`: dev-ml7pxvj6vg32j740.au.auth0.com
- `AUTH0_CLIENT_ID`: Your Auth0 client ID
- `AUTH0_AUDIENCE`: https://api.fulqrom.com.au
- `API_BASE_URL`: http://localhost:30001

item.name: Authentication

exec: // Save the access token to both collection and environment variables
console.log("⚠ Now call 'BFF Login' to create session cookies");

request.description:
✅ **THIS WORKS!** - Machine-to-machine authentication

Use this for testing the API in Postman. This grant type authenticates as the application itself (not as a specific user).

**What you get:**
- Valid access token for API calls
- No user context (no user-specific permissions)
- Works without any Auth0 setup changes

**Steps:**
1. Click Send
2. Token automatically saved
3. Use any protected endpoint

**Required Variables:**
- `AUTH0_DOMAIN`: dev-ml7pxvj6vg32j740.au.auth0.com
- `AUTH0_CLIENT_ID`: L3JN7NIRm67O9wBfxex1jRQJZwIUt6cq
- `AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET`: Your client secret
- `AUTH0_AUDIENCE`: https://api.fulqrom.com.au

exec: console.log("✓ User now exists in database");

request.description:
Sync or create user from Auth0 to MongoDB database. This is a public endpoint that creates the user record if it doesn't exist.

**Run this ONCE before using BFF Login if the user doesn't exist in the database.**

Note: Replace auth0_id with the actual Auth0 user ID from your Auth0 dashboard.

exec: // Session cookies are automatically saved by Postman
console.log("✓ Session cookies (sid, csrf) are now active");
console.log("✓ You can now call protected endpoints");

request.description:
Create a server-side session from the Auth0 token. This sets HttpOnly cookies (sid, csrf) that will be used for all subsequent API calls.

**Steps:**
1. Run "Auth0 Login" first to get the access token
2. Run this endpoint to create session cookies
3. All other endpoints will use the session cookies automatically

**Response:**
- Sets `sid` cookie (HttpOnly, session ID)
- Sets `csrf` cookie (CSRF protection)
- Returns user information and session metadata
Get current authenticated user information. Uses session cookies for authentication.
Invalidate current session and clear cookies.

item.description: Auth0 authentication endpoints for obtaining access tokens and BFF session management.

request.description:
Example of a protected endpoint that requires authentication.

This request will automatically use the Bearer token from the collection variable `access_token`.

query.description: Search by organisation name, business number, or trading name
Maximum number of results to return (default: 50)

request.description:
List all customers with optional search and limit parameters.

**Query Parameters:**
- `search`: Filter by organisation name, business number, or trading name
- `limit`: Maximum number of results (default: 50)

**Examples:**
- Search: `?search=GKB`
- Limit: `?limit=20`
- Combined: `?search=property&limit=10`
Get a single customer by ID with full details. Replace :id in the URL with the actual customer ID.

Create a new customer with comprehensive details.

**Required Fields:**
- `organisation.organisation_name` - Organisation name

**Optional Fields:**

**Organisation:**
- `email_domain` - Company email domain
- `logo_url` - URL to organisation logo
- `building_image` - URL to building/office image
- `notes` - Additional notes about organisation
- `metadata` - Key-value pairs for custom data

**Company Profile:**
- `business_number` - ABN (11 digits, Australian Business Number)
- `company_number` - ACN (9 digits, Australian Company Number)
- `trading_name` - Trading/DBA name
- `industry_type` - Industry category
- `organisation_size` - Company size (e.g., "Small (1-50)", "Medium (50-250)", "Large (250+)")

**Addresses:**
- `business_address` - Physical business location (street, suburb, state, postcode)
- `postal_address` - Mailing address (street, suburb, state, postcode)

**Contact Methods:** (Array)
- `full_name` - Contact person name
- `job_title` - Position/title
- `department` - Department name
- `role_type` - Role category
- `contact_type` - Contact category
- `platform_access` - Access level
- `is_primary` - Mark as primary contact
- `contact_methods` - Array of contact methods (Email, Phone, Mobile, etc.)

**Metadata:** (Array)
- Custom key-value pairs for additional data

**System:**
- `is_active` - Active status (default: true)

**Australian Data:**
- ABN: 11 digits (business_number)
- ACN: 9 digits (company_number)
- States: NSW, VIC, QLD, SA, WA, TAS, NT, ACT
- Postcodes: 4 digits

Update an existing customer with comprehensive details.

**All fields are optional** - only send fields you want to update.

**Available Fields:**

**Organisation:**
- `organisation_name` - Organisation name
- `email_domain` - Company email domain
- `logo_url` - URL to organisation logo
- `building_image` - URL to building/office image
- `notes` - Additional notes
- `metadata` - Key-value pairs (object)

**Company Profile:**
- `business_number` - ABN (11 digits)
- `company_number` - ACN (9 digits)
- `trading_name` - Trading name
- `industry_type` - Industry category
- `organisation_size` - Company size

**Addresses:**
- `business_address` - Physical location (street, suburb, state, postcode)
- `postal_address` - Mailing address (street, suburb, state, postcode)

**Contact Methods:** (Array - replaces entire array)
- Full contact objects with contact_methods array

**Metadata:** (Array - replaces entire array)
- Custom key-value pairs

**System:**
- `is_active` - Active status (boolean)

**Headers Required:**
- `If-Match: W/"v{{customer_version}}"` - For optimistic locking

**Note:** This endpoint uses optimistic locking. The version header must match the current version or the update will fail with 409 Conflict.
Delete a customer by ID (soft delete). Uses the ID saved from Create Customer request.
List all contacts for a specific customer
Get a specific contact by ID for a customer
Get the primary contact for a customer
Search contacts for a customer by various criteria
Create a new contact for a customer
Update an existing contact for a customer

query.description: Search by asset number, make, model, or serial
Filter by asset category (Boiler System, Chiller System, etc.)
Filter by condition (Excellent, Good, Average, Poor, Critical)
Filter by criticality (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

request.description:
List all assets with comprehensive filtering, pagination, and sorting.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` - Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` - Results per page (default: 50)
- `search` - Search by asset number, make, model, or serial
- `category` - Asset category (Boiler System, Chiller System, Pump System, etc.)
- `status` - Status (Active, Inactive, Decommissioned)
- `condition` - Condition (Excellent, Good, Average, Poor, Critical)
- `criticality_level` - Criticality (Low, Medium, High, Critical)
- `customer_id` - Filter by customer
- `site_id` - Filter by site
- `building_id` - Filter by building
- `floor_id` - Filter by floor
- `make` - Filter by manufacturer
- `model` - Filter by model
- `level` - Filter by level
- `area` - Filter by area/location
- `device_id` - Filter by device ID
- `asset_no` - Filter by asset number
- `refrigerant` - Filter by refrigerant type
- `owner` - Filter by owner
- `service_status` - Filter by service status
- `age_min` / `age_max` - Age range filter (years)
- `purchase_cost_min` / `purchase_cost_max` - Purchase cost range (AUD)
- `current_value_min` / `current_value_max` - Current value range (AUD)
- `test_result` - Filter by test result
- `is_active` - Filter by active status
- `sort_by` - Sort field
- `sort_order` - Sort direction (asc, desc)

**Examples:**
- Search: `?search=Chiller`
- Filter by category: `?category=Chiller System`
- Filter by building and condition: `?building_id=123&condition=Good`
- Age range: `?age_min=5&age_max=10`
- Cost range: `?purchase_cost_min=10000&purchase_cost_max=50000`
- Combined: `?category=HVAC&criticality_level=High&is_active=true&sort_by=asset_no`

request.description:
Create a new asset with comprehensive HVAC/facility details.

**Required Fields:**
- `customer_id` - Customer ID (required)

**Optional Fields:**

**Hierarchy & Location:**
- `site_id` - Associated site
- `building_id` - Associated building
- `floor_id` - Associated floor
- `level` - Level/floor level (e.g., "Ground Floor", "Level 2")
- `area` - Area/location within floor

**Asset Identification:**
- `asset_id` - Custom asset ID
- `asset_no` - Asset number (unique per customer)
- `device_id` - IoT device ID

**Classification & Status:**
- `status` - Status (Active, Inactive, Decommissioned)
- `category` - Category (Boiler System, Chiller System, Pump System, AHU, Fan Coil Unit, Cooling Tower, VRV/VRF System, etc.)
- `type` - Specific type (e.g., "Chiller - Water Cooled", "Boiler - Gas Fired")
- `condition` - Condition (Excellent, Good, Average, Poor, Critical)
- `criticality_level` - Criticality level (Low, Medium, High, Critical)

**Equipment Details:**
- `make` - Manufacturer/make
- `model` - Model number
- `serial` - Serial number

**HVAC/Refrigerant Information:**
- `refrigerant` - Refrigerant type (R-134a, R-410A, R-407C, etc.)
- `refrigerant_capacity` - Refrigerant capacity (e.g., "150 kg")
- `refrigerant_consumption` - Annual consumption (e.g., "2.5 kg/year")

**Ownership & Service:**
- `owner` - Asset owner
- `da19_life_expectancy` - Expected life (years)
- `service_status` - Service status (Under Warranty, Maintenance Contract, Ad-hoc)

**Dates & Testing:**
- `date_of_installation` - Installation date (ISO 8601 or Date object)
- `age` - Age in years (string)
- `last_test_date` - Last test/inspection date
- `last_test_result` - Test result description

**Financial Information:**
- `purchase_cost_aud` - Purchase cost in AUD
- `current_book_value_aud` - Current book value in AUD
- `weight_kgs` - Weight in kilograms

**System:**
- `is_active` - Active status (default: true)

**Australian Standards:**
- Currency: AUD (Australian Dollars)
- Weights: Metric (kg)
- Refrigerant standards: AS/NZS compliance

request.description:
Update an existing asset with comprehensive details.

**All fields are optional** - only send fields you want to update.

**Available Fields:**

**Hierarchy & Location:**
- `customer_id` - Customer ID
- `site_id` - Site ID
- `building_id` - Building ID
- `floor_id` - Floor ID
- `level` - Level/floor level
- `area` - Area/location

**Asset Identification:**
- `asset_id` - Custom asset ID
- `asset_no` - Asset number
- `device_id` - IoT device ID

**Classification & Status:**
- `status` - Status
- `category` - Category
- `type` - Type
- `condition` - Condition
- `criticality_level` - Criticality

**Equipment Details:**
- `make` - Manufacturer
- `model` - Model number
- `serial` - Serial number

**HVAC/Refrigerant:**
- `refrigerant` - Refrigerant type
- `refrigerant_capacity` - Capacity
- `refrigerant_consumption` - Annual consumption

**Ownership & Service:**
- `owner` - Owner
- `da19_life_expectancy` - Life expectancy
- `service_status` - Service status

**Dates & Testing:**
- `date_of_installation` - Installation date
- `age` - Age (years)
- `last_test_date` - Last test date
- `last_test_result` - Test result

**Financial:**
- `purchase_cost_aud` - Purchase cost (AUD)
- `current_book_value_aud` - Current value (AUD)
- `weight_kgs` - Weight (kg)

**System:**
- `is_active` - Active status

**Headers Required:**
- `If-Match: W/"v{{asset_version}}"` - For optimistic locking

**Note:** This endpoint uses optimistic locking. The version header must match the current version or the update will fail with 409 Conflict.
Delete an asset by ID (soft delete). Uses the ID saved from Create Asset request.

query.description: Search by document name, description, or tags

request.description:
List all documents with comprehensive filtering and pagination.

**Query Parameters:**
- `page` - Page number for pagination (default: 1)
- `limit` - Results per page (default: 20)
- `search` - Search by document name, description, or tags
- `category` - Filter by document category
- `type` - Filter by document type
- `status` - Filter by document status
- `customer_id` - Filter by customer
- `site_id` - Filter by site
- `building_id` - Filter by building
- `floor_id` - Filter by floor
- `asset_id` - Filter by asset
- `tenant_id` - Filter by tenant
- `vendor_id` - Filter by vendor
- `tags` - Filter by tags
- `sort_by` - Sort field (created_at, name, etc.)
- `sort_order` - Sort direction (asc, desc)

**Examples:**
- Search: `?search=HVAC`
- Filter by category: `?category=Drawing Register`
- Filter by building: `?building_id=123456789`
- Combined: `?category=Compliance&status=Approved&limit=50`

formdata.description: Document file to upload (PDF, DOCX, DWG, etc.)

request.description:
Create a new document with file upload.

**Endpoint:** POST /api/documents

**Content-Type:** multipart/form-data

**Required Fields:**
- `file` - Document file (PDF, DOCX, DWG, JPG, PNG, etc.)
- `name` - Document name
- `category` - Document category
- `type` - Document type
- `customer_id` - Customer ID

**Optional Fields:**
- `description` - Document description
- `site_id`, `building_id`, `floor_id` - Location associations
- `tags` - Comma-separated tags
- `engineering_discipline` - Engineering discipline
- `regulatory_framework`, `compliance_status`, etc. - Compliance fields

**How to Use:**
1. Select file in Body tab → form-data
2. Click "Select Files" next to the `file` field
3. Fill in required text fields (name, category, type, customer_id)
4. Add optional fields as needed
5. Send request

**Response:**
- Returns created document with file metadata
- File uploaded to S3 with secure URL
- Document ID saved to {{document_id}} for use in other requests

formdata.description: New version of the document file

formdata.value: Updated HVAC compliance certificate with new equipment

request.description:
Create a new version of an existing document with file upload.

**Endpoint:** POST /api/documents/:id/versions

**Content-Type:** multipart/form-data

**Use Case:**
When you need to update a document with a new file version while keeping the history of previous versions.

**Form Data Fields:**
- `file` - New version file (required)
- `comment` - Change notes/description (optional)

**Version Management:**
- Creates new document record with incremented version_sequence
- Links to original via document_group_id
- Sets is_current_version = true for new version
- Previous version marked as is_current_version = false
- Maintains complete version history

**Response:**
- Returns new document version with updated file metadata
- version_number: Incremented version (e.g., "2.0", "3.0")
- version_sequence: Numeric sequence counter
- version_metadata: Uploaded by, timestamp, change notes

**How to Use:**
1. Have a document_id from Create Document or List Documents
2. Select new file version in Postman Body tab
3. Add change comment describing what changed
4. Send request
5. New version created and linked to document group

Get version history for a document.

**Endpoint:** GET /api/documents/:id/version-history

**Path Parameters:**
- `id` - Document ID

**Returns:** Array of all versions for this document

Download a specific version of a document.

**Endpoint:** GET /api/documents/versions/:versionId/download

**Path Parameters:**
- `versionId` - ID of the specific document version to download

**Use Case:**
Download an older version of a document for review or recovery.

**Response:**
- Redirects to S3 signed URL for file download
- OR returns file stream directly
- Sets appropriate Content-Disposition header for download

**How to Use:**
1. Get version ID from "Get All Document Versions"
2. Use that version's _id as versionId
3. Send request to download that specific version
4. Browser/Postman will download the file

**Example:**
If "Get All Document Versions" returns version 2.0 with _id "abc122":
GET /api/documents/versions/abc122/download

exec: console.log("✓ Document restored to previous version");

request.description:
Restore a document to a previous version.

**Endpoint:** POST /api/documents/:id/restore-version

**Path Parameters:**
- `id` - Document ID

**Request Body:**
```json
{
  "version_sequence": 2,
  "comment": "Restoring to version 2"
}
```

**What Happens:**
- Creates NEW version copying from specified version_sequence
- Marks new version as current
- Preserves complete history

Download the current document file.

**Endpoint:** GET /api/documents/:id/download

**Path Parameters:**
- `id` - Document ID

**Use Case:**
Download the current/latest version of a document file.

**Response:**
- Redirects to S3 signed URL for secure download
- OR streams file directly
- Sets Content-Disposition header for file download
- Filename from file.file_meta.file_name

**How to Use:**
1. Have document_id in environment variables
2. Send GET request
3. File downloads automatically in Postman or browser

Get preview URL for the current document file.

**Endpoint:** GET /api/documents/:id/preview

**Path Parameters:**
- `id` - Document ID

**Use Case:**
Get a signed URL for previewing document in browser without downloading.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "preview_url": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/...",
    "expires_in": 3600,
    "file_type": "application/pdf",
    "supports_preview": true
  }
}
```

**Preview Support:**
- PDF: Full preview in browser
- Images (JPG, PNG): Display in browser
- Office files: May require viewer integration
- Text files: Direct display

**How to Use:**
1. Send GET request with document_id
2. Receive preview_url in response
3. Use URL in iframe or window.open()
4. URL expires after specified time (default: 1 hour)

Update an existing document with comprehensive details.

**All fields are optional** - only send fields you want to update.

**Available Fields:**

**Basic Information:**
- `name` - Document name
- `description` - Description
- `version` - Version number
- `category` - Category
- `type` - Type
- `engineering_discipline` - Engineering discipline
- `status` - Document status

**Compliance & Regulatory:**
- `regulatory_framework` - Regulatory standard
- `certification_number` - Certificate number
- `compliance_framework` - Compliance framework
- `compliance_status` - Compliance status
- `issue_date` - Issue date
- `expiry_date` - Expiry date
- `review_date` - Review date
- `frequency` - Review frequency

**Tags:**
- `tags.tags` - Array of tags (replaces entire array)

**Location & Associations:**
- `location` - Location object (site, building, floor, assets, tenant, vendor)
- `customer.customer_id` - Customer ID

**Drawing Info:**
- `drawing_info` - Drawing information object (for Drawing Register category)

**Access Control:**
- `access_control.access_level` - Access level
- `access_control.access_users` - Array of user emails (replaces entire array)

**Approval:**
- `approval_config` - Approval configuration object

**Headers Required:**
- `If-Match: W/"v{{document_version}}"` - For optimistic locking

**Note:** This endpoint uses optimistic locking. The version header must match the current version or the update will fail with 409 Conflict.
Delete a document by ID (soft delete). Uses the ID saved from Create Document request.

Approve a document that requires approval
Reject a document with required comment explaining reason
Revoke a previously granted approval
Get all documents pending approval for the current user
Get complete approval history for a specific document
Get all comments for a specific document
Add a review or comment to a document with optional rating
Delete a user by ID (soft delete). Uses the ID saved from Create User request.

exec: // You can add logic here to check if token is expired and refresh automatically
